pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:4.1: 13. The second training rule on bad behavior
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:5.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:5.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā had been pressed by the Order. She then said to the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:5.3: “But, Venerables, you should socialize; don’t live separately.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:5.4: There are other nuns too in the Order who have such behavior and such a reputation, and who harass the Order of nuns and hide each other’s offenses. The Order says nothing to them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:5.5: It’s because of disrespect, contempt, intolerance, slander, and weakness that the Order of nuns says to you, ‘Sisters, you constantly socialize, behave badly, have a bad reputation, are notorious, harass the Order of nuns, and hide each other’s offenses. Be secluded, Venerables. The Order praises seclusion for the Sisters.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:6.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:23.2: For one who commits the offense entailing suspension, the offense of wrong conduct and the serious offenses are annulled.

pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:33.1: “Venerables, the seventeen rules on offenses entailing suspension have been recited,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:33.2: nine being immediate offenses, eight after the third announcement.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:33.3: If a nun commits any one of them, she must undertake a trial period of a half-month toward both Orders.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:33.4: When this is completed, she is to be rehabilitated wherever there is an Order of at least twenty nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:33.5: If that nun is rehabilitated by an Order of nuns of even one less than twenty,
pli-tv-bi-vb-ss13:33.6: that nun is not rehabilitated and those nuns are at fault. This is proper procedure.
